Paragraph.Text: an analysis of how the level of performance of the new features is equivalent or superior to the level of performance required by the prescribed standards, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of how a vehicle or engine equipped with the new features would, if exempted, differ from a vehicle or engine that conforms to the prescribed standards, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the results of tests conducted on the new features that demonstrate a level of performance that is equivalent or superior to that required by the prescribed standards;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that an exemption would facilitate the development or the field evaluation of the vehicle or the engine; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the company intends, at the end of the exemption period,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to have the vehicle or the engine conform to the prescribed standards,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to apply for a further exemption, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: to request that the prescribed standards be amended to incorporate the new features.

Subsection.Text: If the basis of an application for an exemption is the development of new kinds of vehicles, engines or vehicle or engine systems or components referred to in paragraph 156(1)(c) of the Act, the company must include in the submission to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the research, development and testing documentation establishing that an exemption would not substantially diminish the control of emissions of the vehicle or the engine, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a detailed description of how the vehicle or the engine equipped with the new kinds of vehicle systems or components would, if exempted, differ from one that conforms to the prescribed standards,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the reasons why not conforming to the prescribed standards would not substantially diminish the control of emissions of the vehicle or the engine, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of other means of achieving conformity that were considered and the reasons for rejecting each of them;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: evidence that an exemption would facilitate the development or the field evaluation of the vehicle or the engine; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement as to whether the company intends, at the end of the exemption period, to have the vehicle or the engine conform to the prescribed standards.

Subsection.Text: If a company wishes to obtain a new exemption to take effect after the expiry of an exemption referred to in subsection (3) or (4), the company must submit, in writing, to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information required under subsection (3) or (4), as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the total number of vehicles or engines sold in Canada under the expiring exemption.

Subsection.Text: The notice of defect referred to in subsections 157(1) and (4) of the Act must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the company giving the notice and its street address and, if different, mailing address, and the name, email address, telephone number and, if any, facsimile number of the appropriate contact person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of vehicles, the range or ranges of vehicle identification numbers for the vehicles in respect of which the notice is given, if known, and, for each of those vehicles, its make, model and model year and the period during which it was manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of engines, for each engine in respect of which the notice is given, its make, model and model year and the period during which it was manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of trailers, the range or ranges of trailer identification numbers for the trailers in respect of which the notice is given, if known, and, for each of those trailers,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its make,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its model or, if there is no model, its type, length and axle configuration,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its model year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the period during which it was manufactured;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the total number of vehicles, engines or trailers in respect of which the notice is given or, if the total number is not known, the estimated number, and the number or estimated number of vehicles, engines or trailers in each identifying classification;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the estimated percentage of the potentially affected vehicles, engines or trailers that contain the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: an evaluation of the pollution risk arising from the defect;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the measures to be taken to correct the defect; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a chronology of the principal events that led to the determination of the existence of the defect, if known.

Subsection.Text: The notice of defect must be given in writing and, when given to a person other than the Minister, must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in both official languages; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the person’s official language of choice, if known.

Subsection.Text: A company must, within 60 days after the day on which a notice of defect is given, submit to the Minister the initial report referred to in subsection 157(7) of the Act containing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any changes to the information referred to in subsection (1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if not already provided in the notice, the range or ranges of vehicle or trailer identification numbers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if not already provided in the notice, the total number of vehicles, engines or trailers in respect of which the notice was given and the number of vehicles, engines or trailers in each identifying classification;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if not already provided in the notice, a chronology of the principal events that led to the determination of the existence of the defect; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: copies of all notices, bulletins and other circulars issued by the company in respect of the defect, including a detailed description of the nature and physical location of the defect with diagrams and other illustrations, as necessary.

Subsection.Text: If a company submits an initial report under subsection (3), it must, within 45 days after the day on which each quarter ends, submit quarterly reports to the Minister respecting the defect and its correction that contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number, title or other identification assigned by the company to the notice of defect;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the revised number of vehicles, engines or trailers in respect of which the notice of defect was given;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the notice of defect was given to the current owners of the affected vehicles, engines or trailers and the dates of any follow-up communications with those owners in respect of the notice; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the total number or percentage of vehicles, engines or trailers repaired by or on behalf of the company, including vehicles, engines or trailers requiring inspection only.

Subsection.Text: For the application of section 157 of the Act, the CO2 emission standard that applies

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to Class 2B and Class 3 heavy-duty vehicles and cab-complete vehicles — excluding those that are vocational vehicles or incomplete vocational vehicles — or to spark-ignition engines that conform to the alternative CO2 emission standard referred to in section 25 is the product of 1.1 multiplied by the CO2 emission value for that vehicle configuration, rounded to the nearest gram per mile;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to vocational vehicles is the result of the GEM computer simulation model using the parameters specified in subsection 26(2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to tractors of the 2020 model year or an earlier model year is the result of the GEM computer simulation model using the parameters specified in subsection 27(2), except that the coefficient of aerodynamic drag may originate from a bin for which the coefficient of aerodynamic drag is higher than that of the bin of the subject vehicle;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to tractors of the 2021 model year or a subsequent model year is the result of the GEM computer simulation model using the parameters specified in subsection 27(2);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: to heavy-duty engines — other than engines referred to in paragraph (f), (g) or (h) — is the product of 1.03 multiplied by the applicable standard set out in section 30 for that engine, or in the case of an engine that is grouped into a fleet referred to in section 18, the product of 1.03 multiplied by the CO2 deteriorated emission level applicable to the fleet;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: to heavy-duty engines of the 2014 to 2016 model years that conform to the alternative CO2 emission standard referred to in subsection 31(1) is the product of 1.03 multiplied by the alternative CO2 emission standard;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: to heavy-duty engines of the 2013 to 2016 model years that conform to the alternative CO2 emission standard referred to in subsection 31(2) is the product of 1.03 multiplied by the alternative CO2 emission standard;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: to heavy-duty engines of the 2024 to 2026 model years that conform to the alternative CO2 emission standard referred to in subsection 31(5) is the product of 1.03 multiplied by the alternative CO2 emission standard, or in the case of an engine that is grouped into a fleet referred to in section 18, the product of 1.03 multiplied by the CO2 deteriorated emission level applicable to the fleet; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: to full-aero and partial-aero box van trailers is the result of the compliance equation set out in section 515(a) of Title 40, chapter I, subchapter U, part 1037, subpart F, of the CFR.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of section 157 of the Act, the standard that applies to a non-box trailer or a non-aero box van trailer is the one that is set out in section 16.1.
